intro: Bistorta abukumensis, commonly known as the Abukumensis bistorta, is a perennial herb native to specific regions in East Africa. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its rhizomatous growth and distinctive leaf morphology. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a prominent midrib and a hairy surface, typical of the genus Bistorta. Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and are usually greenish-white in color. Bistorta abukumensis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and rocky slopes.
